frameDefinitions: A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.
A Perpetrator (generally intentionally) commits a Crime, i.e. does something not permitted by the laws of society.
In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the Convict or his or her Representative applies to a higher Court to reverse the Decision of the lower court on certain Grounds. '
The  Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content.
In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity  or group (the Governed) or an Activity.
frameExamples: You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
They <t>perpetrated</t> a felony by substituting a lie for negotiations.
The defense plans to <t>appeal</t> the court's decision on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b .
Mr Smithers always <t>encourages</t> the employees to stay late and work harder.
Sebek em hat was a <t>Leader</t> of Priests. ca. 1780 BC
listRoleDefinitions: The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The individual that commits a <fen>Crime</fen>.
An act, generally intentional, that has been formally forbidden by law.
When the <fen>Crime</fen> was committed.
The location where the <fen>Crime</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is the individual convicted of the crime who may make an appeal on her or his behalf.
The <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher court on behalf of the <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Decision</fen> is the ruling handed down by the first court.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Convict</fen> or <fen>Representative</fen> appeals.
The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.
The person that the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
What the communication is about.
The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the <fen>Addressee</fen> towards the <fen>Content</fen>.
An entity which the <fen>Speaker</fen> believes should participate in the action.
The time at which the lobbying occurs.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> attemtps susaion on an <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.

The <fen>Leader</fen> is the one who has the role of leading.  With verbs, and with predicate nominals linking an individual to a <fen>Role</fen>, the <fen>Leader</fen> is usually the External Argument:

The role played by the <fen>Leader</fen> in a given situation, often an official title; incorporated in most noun LUsin this frame. When expressed separately from the target, <fen>Role</fen> usually occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>as</ment>.
The entity whose actions or beliefs the <fen>Leader</fen> directs in the context of a joint activity or movement.  This entity can be a political body, a person, or a group of people.
The <fen>Leader</fen> directs the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> refers to the point in time that the leadership took place.
The locale from which the <fen>Leader</fen> leads the <fen>Governed</fen> or the <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples:
The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.
How can <fex>he</fex> commit treason against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?
How can he commit <fex>treason</fex> against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?
A murder perpetrated <fex>at 1:08AM this morning</fex> was not investigated until noon today.
We have jurisdiction over crimes committed <fex>in Woodside County</fex>.
<fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.
The general led his troops into battle <fex>on June 22, 1883</fex>.
He ruled the west <fex>from his palace in Milan</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Iran Human Rights Documentation Center

the Mykonos Trial The End of the Dispensable IranianDawn
